title: Quiz 4: Achievements, Challenges & Way Forward
description: Evaluates understanding of the progress made in PHC, the persistent challenges (disease burden, resources), and the strategic reforms (NHSSP) for the future.

questions.question: Which of the following is cited as a major achievement of the PHC strategy in Kenya?

options.text: Complete eradication of all communicable diseases
Decrease in childhood diseases like polio and measles
Increase in curative service budget to 90%

questions.explanation: PHC led to the rapid expansion of immunization (KEPI), decreasing childhood diseases like polio and measles.

questions.question: Curative services consume approximately ___BLANK___ percent of the health budget, which is a major challenge to PHC implementation.
questions.explanation: Curative services account for about 70% of the budget, leaving little for preventive PHC activities.
questions.hint: It is a high number, more than two-thirds.

questions.question: According to the study material, which diseases combined account for almost 50% of all reported diagnoses in public health facilities? (Select two)
questions.explanation: Malaria and Respiratory Diseases are the major causes of morbidity.

questions.question: The National Health Sector Strategic Plan (NHSSP) aims to centralize decision-making back to the Ministry Headquarters.
questions.explanation: The NHSSP commits to **decentralization**, giving more authority to districts and facilities.
questions.hint: The trend is towards local control, not central.

questions.question: Match the Challenge with its Description:

pairs.right: Misunderstanding PHC as just 'primary level' care

questions.explanation: Sustainability is linked to donors; Integration to the misconception of PHC; Resources to the urban/curative bias; Water to the 55% statistic.
questions.hint: Connect the keyword to the specific problem.

questions.question: Analyze the graph description below. What trend does this indicate about PHC success?

richContent.content: Graph Description: The line for 'Infant Mortality Rate' shows a steady downward slope over the decade following the introduction of KEPI.

options.text: PHC has failed to improve child health
Preventive programmes like immunization have reduced mortality
Curative services are the only effective measure

questions.explanation: A downward slope in mortality after immunization programs indicates success in preventive health care.
questions.hint: Lower mortality is a good thing.

questions.question: What is the acronym for the national immunization programme that is considered a major PHC achievement?
questions.explanation: KEPI stands for Kenya Expanded Programme of Immunisation.

questions.question: Which of the following are recommended as the 'Way Forward' for health workers to improve PHC? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Rational use of drugs and resources

questions.explanation: The Way Forward includes rational resource use, updating skills (CPD), and effective surveillance. Ignoring policy is incorrect.

questions.question: Arrange the hierarchy of reform implementation from policy making to local execution:
questions.explanation: Reforms flow from HQ (Policy) -> Province (Supervision) -> District (Execution) -> Local (Community Action).

questions.question: What is the 'Bamako Initiative' related to in the context of local institutions?

options.text: Community financing and management of health funds

questions.explanation: The Bamako Initiative is a strategy for strengthening PHC through community financing and management of local health funds.
questions.hint: It involves money and community management.
